title: Dennis W. Hickey
text:
Dennis William Hickey (September 20, 1844 - October 26, 1908) was a <a href="Union%20Army">Union Army</a> soldier in the <a href="American%20Civil%20War">American Civil War</a> who received the U.S. military's highest decoration, the <a href="Medal%20of%20Honor">Medal of Honor</a>.
Hickey was born in <a href="Troy%2C%20New%20York">Troy, New York</a> on September 20, 1844. He was awarded the Medal of Honor, for extraordinary heroism shown on June 29, 1864, while serving as a <a href="Sergeant%23United_States">Sergeant</a> with Company E, 2nd New York Volunteer Cavalry Regiment, at Stony Creek Bridge, Virginia. His Medal of Honor was issued on April 18, 1891.
Hickey died at the age of 64, on and was buried at Saint Georges Cemetery in <a href="Newburgh%2C%20New%20York">Newburgh, New York</a>.
